dt: {bc}a conspicuous object (such as a banner) formerly carried at the top of a pole and used to mark a rallying point especially in battle or to serve as an emblem
{bc}a long narrow tapering flag that is personal to an individual or corporation and bears heraldic devices
{bc}the personal flag of the head of a state or of a member of a royal family
{bc}an organization flag carried by a mounted or motorized military unit
{bc}something established by authority, custom, or general consent as a model or example {bc}{sx|criterion||}
{bc}something set up and established by authority as a rule for the measure of quantity, weight, extent, value, or quality
{bc}the fineness and legally fixed weight of the metal used in coins
{bc}the basis of value in a monetary system
{bc}a structure built for or serving as a base or support
{bc}a shrub or herb grown with an erect main stem so that it forms or resembles a tree
{bc}a fruit tree grafted on a stock that does not induce dwarfing

{bc}the upper, large, often lobed petal of a {d_link|papilionaceous|papilionaceous} flower (as of a pea or bean plant) {bc}{sx|banner|banner:1|6}, {sx|vexillum||3} {dx}compare {dxt|keel:2|keel:2|2b}, {dxt|wing:1|wing:1|2e(2)}{/dx}
{bc}one of the three inner usually erect and incurved petals of an iris {dx}compare {dxt|fall:2|fall:2|3f}{/dx}
{bc}a musical composition (such as a song) that has become a part of the standard repertoire

pt: {sc}standard{/sc} {sc}criterion{/sc} {sc}gauge{/sc} {sc}yardstick{/sc} {sc}touchstone{/sc} mean a means of determining what a thing should be. {sc}standard{/sc} applies to any definite rule, principle, or measure established by authority.
{sc}criterion{/sc} may apply to anything used as a test of quality whether formulated as a rule or principle or not.
{sc}gauge{/sc} applies to a means of testing a particular dimension (such as thickness, depth, diameter) or figuratively a particular quality or aspect.

pt.t: polls as a {it}gauge{/it} of voter dissatisfaction

pt: {sc}yardstick{/sc} is an informal substitute for {sc}criterion{/sc} that suggests quantity more often than quality.

pt.t: housing construction as a {it}yardstick{/it} of economic growth

pt: {sc}touchstone{/sc} suggests a simple test of the authenticity or value of something intangible.

pt.t: fine service is one {it}touchstone{/it} of a first-class restaurant

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}estandard{/it} banner, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English {it}standan{/it} to stand and probably to Old High German {it}hart{/it} hard
shortdef: a conspicuous object (such as a banner) formerly carried at the top of a pole and used to mark a rallying point especially in battle or to serve as an emblem
a long narrow tapering flag that is personal to an individual or corporation and bears heraldic devices
the personal flag of the head of a state or of a member of a royal family

dt: {bc}constituting or conforming to a standard especially as established by law or custom
{bc}sound and usable but not of top quality
{bc}regularly and widely used, available, or supplied
{bc}substantially uniform and well established by usage in the speech and writing of the educated and widely recognized as acceptable

dt.t: {wi}standard{/wi} pronunciation is subject to regional variations

shortdef: constituting or conforming to a standard especially as established by law or custom
sound and usable but not of top quality
regularly and widely used, available, or supplied

dt: {bc}one who bears a standard or banner
{bc}one that leads an organization, movement, or party

shortdef: one who bears a standard or banner
one that leads an organization, movement, or party

dt: {bc}a measure of the dispersion of a frequency distribution that is the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviation of each of the class frequencies from the arithmetic mean of the frequency distribution
{bc}a similar quantity found by dividing by one less than the number of squares in the sum of squares instead of taking the arithmetic mean

{bc}a parameter that indicates the way in which a probability function or a probability density function is centered around its mean and that is equal to the square root of the moment in which the deviation from the mean is squared

shortdef: a measure of the dispersion of a frequency distribution that is the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviation of each of the class frequencies from the arithmetic mean of the frequency distribution; also : a similar quantity found by dividing by one less than the number of squares in the sum of squares instead of taking the arithmetic mean

a parameter that indicates the way in which a probability function or a probability density function is centered around its mean and that is equal to the square root of the moment in which the deviation from the mean is squared

dt: {bc}the English that with respect to spelling, grammar, pronunciation, and vocabulary is substantially uniform though not devoid of regional differences, that is well established by usage in the formal and informal speech and writing of the educated, and that is widely recognized as acceptable wherever English is spoken and understood

shortdef: the English that with respect to spelling, grammar, pronunciation, and vocabulary is substantially uniform though not devoid of regional differences, that is well established by usage in the formal and informal speech and writing of the educated, and that is widely recognized as acceptable wherever English is spoken and understood

dt: {bc}the standard deviation of the probability function or probability density function of a random variable and especially of a statistic

{bc}the standard error of the mean of a sample from a population with a normal distribution that is equal to the standard deviation of the normal distribution divided by the square root of the sample size

shortdef: the standard deviation of the probability function or probability density function of a random variable and especially of a statistic; specifically : the standard error of the mean of a sample from a population with a normal distribution that is equal to the standard deviation of the normal distribution divided by the square root of the sample size

dt: {bc}a railroad gauge of 4 feet 8¹/₂ inches (1435 millimeters)

shortdef: a railroad gauge of 4 feet 81/2 inches (1435 millimeters)

dt: {bc}a theory in physics that describes the basic components of matter and the forces that govern their interactions

shortdef: a theory in physics that describes the basic components of matter and the forces that govern their interactions
